speaker: Noah
text: I always tell juniors — if you write unclear variable names, the next person gets confused immediately.
ipa: aɪ ˈɔlweɪz tɛl ˈʤuːnjɚz — ɪf ju raɪt ʌnˈklɪɹ ˈvɛɹiəbəl neɪmz | ðə nɛkst ˈpɝsən ɡɛts kənˈfjuzd ɪˈmiːdiətli
stress: I ALWAYS TELL JUNIORS — if YOU WRITE UNCLEAR VARIABLE NAMES | the NEXT PERSON GETS CONFUSED IMMEDIATELY
linking:
"tell juniors" → /tɛl ˈʤuːnjɚz/ (l + j linking)
"write unclear" → /raɪt ʌnˈklɪɹ/ (t + u linking)
"gets confused" → /ɡɛts kənˈfjuzd/ (s + c linking)

speaker: Sophie
text: Totally agree. If someone reads your code and needs to ask questions constantly, you know you failed at readability.
ipa: ˈtoʊtəli əˈɡɹi | ɪf ˈsʌmwʌn ɹidz jɔɹ koʊd ənd nidz tə æsk ˈkwɛsʧənz ˈkɑnstəntli | ju noʊ ju feɪld æt ˌɹidəˈbɪləti
stress: TOTALLY AGREE | if SOMEONE READS YOUR CODE and NEEDS to ASK QUESTIONS CONSTANTLY | you KNOW you FAILED at READABILITY
linking:
"reads your" → /ɹidz jɔɹ/ (z + y linking)
"needs to" → /nidz tə/ (d + t linking)
"ask questions" → /æsk ˈkwɛsʧənz/ (k + q linking)

speaker: Noah
text: Exactly. And if you skip writing tests, bugs slip through way more often.
ipa: ɪɡˈzæktli | ənd ɪf ju skɪp ˈɹaɪtɪŋ tɛsts | bʌɡz slɪp θɹu weɪ mɔɹ ˈɔfən
stress: EXACTLY | and if YOU SKIP WRITING TESTS | BUGS SLIP THROUGH WAY MORE OFTEN
linking:
"skip writing" → /skɪp ˈɹaɪtɪŋ/ (p + r linking)
"bugs slip" → /bʌɡz slɪp/ (z + s linking)

speaker: Sophie
text: Not to mention, if you push code without a second pair of eyes, something usually breaks in production.
ipa: nɑt tə ˈmɛnʃən | ɪf ju pʊʃ koʊd wɪˈðaʊt ə ˈsɛkənd pɛɹ əv aɪz | ˈsʌmθɪŋ ˈjuʒuəli bɹeɪks ɪn pɹəˈdʌkʃən
stress: NOT to MENTION | if YOU PUSH CODE WITHOUT a SECOND PAIR of EYES | SOMETHING USUALLY BREAKS in PRODUCTION
linking:
"push code" → /pʊʃ koʊd/ (sh + c linking)
"pair of" → /pɛɹ əv/ (r + o linking)

speaker: Noah
text: Yup. That’s why I always say — if we follow the checklist, nothing goes wrong.
ipa: jʌp | ðæts waɪ aɪ ˈɔlweɪz seɪ — ɪf wi ˈfɑloʊ ðə ˈʧɛklɪst | ˈnʌθɪŋ ɡoʊz ɹɔŋ
stress: YUP | THAT’S WHY I ALWAYS SAY — if WE FOLLOW the CHECKLIST | NOTHING GOES WRONG
linking:
"follow the" → /ˈfɑloʊ ðə/ (w + th linking)
"nothing goes" → /ˈnʌθɪŋ ɡoʊz/ (ng + g linking)

speaker: Sophie
text: And it’s true! If we review carefully and document changes, the whole process runs smoother.
ipa: ənd ɪts tɹu | ɪf wi ɹɪˈvju ˈkɛɹfəli ənd ˈdɑkjəmənt ˈʧeɪnʤəz | ðə hoʊl ˈpɹɑsɛs ɹʌnz ˈsmuðɚ
stress: AND IT’S TRUE | if WE REVIEW CAREFULLY and DOCUMENT CHANGES | the WHOLE PROCESS RUNS SMOOTHER
linking:
"review carefully" → /ɹɪˈvju ˈkɛɹfəli/ (w + c linking)
"document changes" → /ˈdɑkjəmənt ˈʧeɪnʤəz/ (t + ch linking)

speaker: Noah
text: It’s kind of like a rule of nature in dev work — if you rush, you regret it later.
ipa: ɪts kaɪnd əv laɪk ə ɹul əv ˈneɪʧɚ ɪn dɛv wɝk — ɪf ju ɹʌʃ | ju ɹɪˈɡɹɛt ɪt ˈleɪtɚ
stress: IT’S KIND of LIKE a RULE of NATURE in DEV WORK — if YOU RUSH | YOU REGRET it LATER
linking:
"kind of" → /kaɪnd əv/ (d + o linking)
"rush, you" → /ɹʌʃ ju/ (sh + y linking)

speaker: Sophie
text: Haha, so true. And if you explain your decisions in PRs, people understand them better and learn faster too.
ipa: ˈhɑhɑ | soʊ tɹu | ənd ɪf ju ɪkˈspleɪn jɔɹ dɪˈsɪʒənz ɪn pi ɑɹz | ˈpipəl ˌʌndɚˈstænd ðəm ˈbɛtɚ ənd lɝn ˈfæstɚ tu
stress: HAHA, SO TRUE | and if YOU EXPLAIN YOUR DECISIONS in PRs | PEOPLE UNDERSTAND THEM BETTER and LEARN FASTER TOO
linking:
"explain your" → /ɪkˈspleɪn jɔɹ/ (n + y linking)
"understand them" → /ˌʌndɚˈstænd ðəm/ (d + th linking)
